definition: Bulgaria/Bulgarian/abbr. for 保加利亞|保加利亚[Bao3 jia1 li4 ya4]
to defend/to protect/to keep/to guarantee/to ensure/civil administration unit in the baojia 保甲[bao3 jia3] system (old)

sentences.english: I used to work as a cleaner in a hospital.
sentences.chinese: 我過去在醫院裏做保潔員。

sentences.english: METHODS The existing problems of cleaning staffs in the hospital infection, such as system, training, hand washing and protective measures were analyzed.
sentences.chinese: 方法對保潔員在醫院感染中出現的問題進行重點分析。

sentences.english: If there is oil stains in foam detergent scrub, such as cleaning is very short.
sentences.chinese: 如有油跡等用泡沫清潔劑擦洗就好了，保潔很簡略。

sentences.english: I hired a house cleaner to clean my rooms .
sentences.chinese: 我僱用了一個保潔員給我打掃房間。

sentences.english: It is energy saving and dust-proof.
sentences.chinese: 具有防塵節能，高度保潔功能。

sentences.english: Attaining with hot water, the use of acne cream, I remember cleaning the face.
sentences.chinese: 用熱水敷臉，運用祛痘膏，記得臉部保潔。

sentences.english: The new utility model referrs to a kind of cleaning guard board for computer keyboard and keyboard cover.
sentences.chinese: 本實用新型是一種用於計算機鍵盤鍵帽的保潔護板。

sentences.english: Next, John and Becky bought a small office-cleaning business.
sentences.chinese: 接下來，約翰和貝基買下了一個辦公室保潔公司。

sentences.english: P&G took three years to become profitable in China.
sentences.chinese: 保潔公司歷經三載纔開始在中國盈利。

definition: public cleanliness/(urban) sanitation/environmental sanitation/abbr. for 環境衛生|环境卫生[huan2 jing4 wei4 sheng1]
to pile up like a mountain (idiom)/a mountain of (paperwork etc)/a large number of sth
to overhaul/to examine and fix (a motor)/to service (a vehicle)
to raise a lantern and fight at night (idiom); fig. to work into the night/to burn the midnight oil
head of a flight of stairs
to water the plants/to water the garden
